sourcesContent:
import React from "react"; function FirstConvo() { return ( <>

First Conversation:

Well most of you may know that Erin and I met at BestBuy where we both worked. After day dreaming about her for months I stumbled upon her sitting alone in the breakroom. I said hello and was greeted with a non enthusiacstic hello. Obviouse that it was not the bestes of days for Erin I decided to try to cheer her up. I Started with the best question you can ask someone who is sad or upset I asked her "what's wrong?". She didn't even give me the time of day and mumbled the socially acceptable answer of "nothing". Only partially conviced by her answer I decided to continue on with my attempt to place her in a better mood by responding, "Well that sounded awefully convicing glad you're doing so well. My day hasn't been too bad, I got like 7K out already and I'm only half way through it!" And that was what got her to finally look up and make eye contact and in the most sincere tone she responded with, "wow... that is so awesome... cool... congrats?.." But I could see in her eye at this point that I needed to really make her smile so I whipped out one of the best jokes in the books. I was a gentleman however and warned her that its more enjoyable to tell and asked who she lived with. She responded "my mom." So I told her I am going to tell you the best joke ever!!! and she has to tell her mom tonight, after asking her to agree multiple times she finally agreed! (although now that I think about it I think it was to get me to shut up cause she was having a pretty crappy day).

And so it began...
A bear walks into a bar.
Goes up to the bartender.
The bear slams his paws on the counter and says I'll have a glace of water..
*long awkard pause (I was kind and only did 15 seconds althought my record is 4 days. Started the joke on our way to Colorado and finished it on our way back)*
...With ice! bartender looks at the bear.
He asks the bear, "Whats with the big pause?"
Bear lifts up his paws and goes "I'm a bearrrr!!!"

To my surpise not even a smile or a chuckle... I assumed I failed and tucked my tail between my legs and left the breakroom after only 3 minutes. The next day I walked into the break room and saw Erin there again. After a good nights sleep and a fresh shower I had a bit more confidence in me to continue my attempt to swoon her with my charm. I asked if she told her mom the joke that I told her yesterday and to my surprise she did... I asked how was it what did she say!? Erin responded well "she kind of just staired at me very confused then said, 'well Erin, I'm glad you're making friends' then she walked away".
And that my friends is how I swooned Erin.

); } export default FirstConvo;
